thread.title: Man kills ex-female friend, lover by setting them on fire
thread.title_full: Man kills ex-female friend, lover by setting them on fire

author: adekunle
title: Man kills ex-female friend, lover by setting them on fire
text:
Home » News » Man kills ex-female friend, lover by setting them on fire Man kills ex-female friend, lover by setting them on fire On 9:56 pm In Crime Guard , News by adekunle Comments 
Lagos – A 51-year-old businessman, Ayobami Oyedutan, and his extra-marital lover have been killed by the estranged boyfriend of the woman. 
The scorned man attacked the duo at a beer parlour in Ijaiye area of Lagos State. He reportedly sprayed them with petrol and set them on fire. 
Witnesses said that the incident happened on Sunday at the woman’s beer parlour located at Americana Street, Jankara, Agbado-Ijaiye, Lagos State. 
The woman died at the bar, while her friend, Oyedutan died on Monday at Gbagada General Hospital following severe burns sustained in the fire. 
Sources said that the attacker, who is now at large, was the estranged lover of the woman who owned the beer parlour, where the petrol attack occurred. 
She was simply identified as ”Mama-Corner”. 
According to a witness: ”The ex-lover of the woman, who was not happy over her unfaithfulness to him, became angry and went to the beer parlour, sprayed the man and woman with petrol and lit them up. 
”The man, who lit the fire, got his cloth burnt as he was running out. The woman died in the beer parlour, the lover man died on Monday at Gbagada General Hospital,” a source said. 
The businessman was buried on Tuesday at his house in Ajasa Village, Command area of Ipaja, Lagos. 
The trio involved in the love triangle were married to different spouses. 
The wife of the late businessman, Mrs Tolu Oyedutan, described his death as a “painful loss’’. 
She told sympathisers that she was with her late husband until he gave up the ghost at about 11 pm on Monday. 
”My regret now is that my five-year-old son won’t live to see his father when he grows up,” the bereaved wife said. 
The police spokesperson in Lagos, ASP Dolapo Badmus, told NAN that the command was yet to be officially informed about the incident. adekunle
